content.text:
# Marwari Muslims

The Marwari Muslims or Marwadi Muslims (, ) are an Indian and Pakistani ethnic group that originate from the Rajasthan region of India. Their language, also called Marwari, is a dialect of Rajasthani and is a part of the western group of Indo-Aryan languages. They can also found in the state of Meghalaya.
Notable people
*Muhammad Hashim Gazdar, (1893 – 1968) representative from Sindh to the Constituent Assembly of Pakistan
*Liaquat Soldier, (1952 – 2011) Pakistani comedy actor, writer and director.
See also
*Islam in India
